functions.name: search
functions.desc: Search Wikipedia for an article with the given title, and get its content. If no such article is found, return similar article names.

msg.content: What are the mottos of the global top 5 universities according to the QS World University Rankings 2024?
What are the mottos of the global top 5 universities according to the QS World University Rankings 2024?

<document>
<title>Massachusetts Institute of Technology</title>
<fragment>
225. **^** "2022-23 Best Global Universities Rankings". *U.S. News & World Report*. Retrieved 2023-02-25.
226. **^** Avery, Christopher; Glickman, Mark E.; Hoxby, Caroline M; Metrick, Andrew (December 2005). "A Revealed Preference Ranking of U.S. Colleges and Universities". *NBER Working Paper No. W10803*. National Bureau of Economic Research. SSRN 601105.
227. **^** "2012 Parchment Top Choice College Rankings: All Colleges". Parchment Inc. Retrieved 2012-06-05.
228. **^** Coughlan, Sean (2014-09-15). "What makes a global top 10 university?". *BBC News*. It's the third year in a row that [MIT] ... has been top of the QS World University Rankings. The biggest single factor in the QS rankings is academic reputation ... calculated by surveying more than 60,000 academics ... Universities with an established name and a strong brand are likely to do better.
229. **^** "NRC Rankings". Retrieved 2008-10-09.
230. **^** "MIT undergraduate engineering again ranked No. 1". MIT News Office. 2010-08-17.

</fragment>
<fragment>
216. **^** "MIT Bootcamps | MIT Innovation Leadership Bootcamp". *bootcamps.mit.edu*.
217. **^** "Starting a Business in Boston, MA: What Makes This City Perfect for Entrepreneurs | Incfile". *www.incfile.com*.
218. **^** "Forbes America's Top Colleges List 2023". *Forbes*. Retrieved 2023-09-22.
219. **^** "2023-2024 Best National Universities". *U.S. News & World Report*. Retrieved 2023-09-22.
220. **^** "2023 National University Rankings". *Washington Monthly*. Retrieved 2024-02-10.
221. **^** "2024 Best Colleges in the U.S." *The Wall Street Journal/College Pulse*. Retrieved 2024-01-27.
222. **^** "ShanghaiRanking's 2023 Academic Ranking of World Universities". Shanghai Ranking Consultancy. Retrieved 2024-02-10.
223. **^** "QS World University Rankings 2025: Top global universities". Quacquarelli Symonds. Retrieved 2024-06-06.
224. **^** "World University Rankings 2024". *Times Higher Education*. Retrieved 2023-09-27.

</fragment>
<fragment>
231. **^** Morgan, John (January 1990). "Top Six Universities Dominate THE World Reputation Rankings". "The rankings suggest that the top six- ... Stanford University and the University of Oxford – form a group of globally recognized "super brands".
232. **^** "SCImago Institutions Rankings – Higher Education – All Regions and Countries – 2019 – Overall Rank". *www.scimagoir.com*.
233. **^** "Stanford and MIT lead THE arts and humanities ranking". *Times Higher Education (THE) World University Rankings*. Times Higher Education (THE). 2017-09-13. Retrieved 2018-01-26.
234. **^** "MIT SHASS: MIT named No. 2 university worldwide for the Arts and Humanities". *shass.mit.edu*. Retrieved 2018-01-26.
235. **^** "Ten institutions that dominated science in 2015". Archived from the original on 2016-04-24. Retrieved 2019-05-28.
236. **^** "10 institutions that dominated science in 2017". 2018-06-12. Retrieved 2019-05-28.
237. **^** "Introduction to the Nature Index". Retrieved 2019-05-28.

</fragment>
<fragment>

Times Higher Education has recognized MIT as one of the world's "six super brands" on its *World Reputation Rankings*, along with Berkeley, Cambridge, Harvard, Oxford, and Stanford.[231] In 2019, it was ranked #3 among the universities around the world by SCImago Institutions Rankings.[232] In 2017, the Times Higher Education World University Rankings also rated MIT the #2 university for arts and humanities.[233][234] MIT was ranked #7 in 2015 and #6 in 2017 of the Nature Index Annual Tables, which measure the largest contributors to papers published in 82 leading journals.[235][236][237] Georgetown University researchers ranked MIT #3 in the US for 20-year return on investment.[238]


  




### Collaborations[edit]


</fragment>
<fragment>

MIT places among the top five in many overall rankings of universities (see table right) and rankings based on students' revealed preferences.[226][227][228] For several years, *U.S. News & World Report*, the QS World University Rankings, and the Academic Ranking of World Universities have ranked MIT's School of Engineering first, as did the 1995 National Research Council report.[229] In the same lists, MIT's strongest showings apart from in engineering are in computer science, the natural sciences, business, architecture, economics, linguistics, mathematics, and, to a lesser extent, political science and philosophy.[230]


</fragment>
<fragment>
238. **^** Center on Education and the Workforce. "Ranking 4,500 Colleges by ROI (2022)". Georgetown University.
239. **^** "A Survey of New England: A Concentration of Talent". *The Economist*. 1987-08-08. MIT for a long time ... stood virtually alone as a university that embraced rather than shunned industry.
240. **^** Roberts, Edward B. (1991). "An Environment for Entrepreneurs". *MIT: Shaping the Future*. Cambridge, Massachusetts: MIT Press. ISBN 0262631415. The war made necessary the formation of new working coalitions ... between these technologists and government officials. These changes were especially noteworthy at MIT.

</fragment>
</document>
msg.name: search

msg.content:
<document>
<title>University of Cambridge</title>
<fragment>
162. **^** "THE World University Rankings 2024". Times Higher Education. 28 September 2023.
163. **^** "QS World University Rankings 2023: Top Global Universities". *Top Universities*. Archived from the original on 17 September 2012. Retrieved 8 June 2022.
164. **^** "ShanghaiRanking's Academic Ranking of World Universities". *www.shanghairanking.com*. Archived from the original on 15 August 2019. Retrieved 1 March 2023.
165. **^** "World University Rankings". *Times Higher Education (THE)*. 25 August 2021. Archived from the original on 25 February 2023. Retrieved 12 October 2022.
166. **^** "QS World University Rankings by Subject 2022". *Top Universities*. Archived from the original on 26 October 2022. Retrieved 8 April 2022.

</fragment>
<fragment>
167. **^** Morgan, John. "Top Six Universities Dominate THE World Reputation Rankings". Archived from the original on 31 March 2015. Retrieved 29 July 2017. "The rankings suggest that the top six-...Stanford University and the University of Oxford – form a group of globally recognised "super brands".
168. **^** "QS World University Rankings (2010)". Archived from the original on 3 April 2011.
169. **^** "QS World University Rankings (2011)". Archived from the original on 1 October 2011.
170. **^** "Thomson Scientific ranks UK research". Thomson Scientific. 4 May 2006. Archived from the original on 21 August 2008. Retrieved 8 September 2008.
171. **^** "Cambridge continues its domination of research resources". *Times Higher Education*. 20 October 2006. Archived from the original on 18 May 2015. Retrieved 9 May 2015.
172. **^** Sheinman, Anna (4 January 2012). "Inside Cambridge: Fizz, Fellows and Formal Hall". *Huffington Post*. Archived from the original on 11 January 2012. Retrieved 9 May 2015.

</fragment>
<fragment>

![](image)University of Cambridge's national league table performance over the past ten years
The University of Cambridge is routinely ranked among the world's top five universities, and has sometimes been ranked as the world's best. As of 2023, the University of Cambridge is ranked the second-best university in the world behind the MIT and the best university in Europe by *QS Rankings*.[163] *ARWU* ranks Cambridge the fourth-best university in the world as of 2023 behind Harvard, Stanford, and MIT.[164] *Times Higher Education* ranks Cambridge third-best in the world (tied with Stanford) in its 2023 rankings behind Oxford and Harvard.[165]


</fragment>
<fragment>
153. **^** "Oldest printing and publishing house". Guinnessworldrecords.com. 22 January 2002. Archived from the original on 24 October 2012. Retrieved 28 March 2012.
154. **^** Black, Michael (1984). *Cambridge University Press, 1583–1984*. pp. 328–9. ISBN 978-0-521-66497-4.
155. **^** "Financial statements of the University of Cambridge" (PDF). November 2022. Archived (PDF) from the original on 11 March 2023. Retrieved 13 April 2023.
156. **^** "About OCR – Oxford and Cambridge and RSA Examinations". OCR. Archived from the original on 4 January 2013. Retrieved 3 January 2013.
157. **^** "Complete University Guide 2025". The Complete University Guide. 14 May 2024.
158. **^** "Guardian University Guide 2024". *The Guardian*. 9 September 2023.
159. **^** "Good University Guide 2024". *The Times*. 15 September 2023.
160. **^** "Academic Ranking of World Universities 2023". Shanghai Ranking Consultancy. 15 August 2023.
161. **^** "QS World University Rankings 2025". Quacquarelli Symonds Ltd. 4 June 2024.

</fragment>
<fragment>

In April 2022, *QS Rankings* ranked Cambridge's programmes among the world's best. Cambridge's Arts and Humanities program is ranked second-best in the world. The University of Cambridge's Engineering and Technology program is ranked second-best in the world. Its Life Sciences and Medicine program is ranked fourth-best in the world. Its Natural Sciences program is ranked third-best in the world. Its Social Sciences and Management program is ranked fourth-best in the world.[166]


In 2011, *Times Higher Education* recognised the University of Cambridge as one of the world's six super brands in its "World Reputation Rankings" along with Berkeley, Harvard, MIT, Oxford, and Stanford.[167]


The University of Cambridge has been highly ranked by most international and UK league tables. It was ranked the best university in the world by *QS World University Rankings* in both their 2010–11 and 2011–12 rankings.[168][169]


</fragment>
</document>

msg.content:
<document>
<title>University of Oxford</title>
<fragment>
176. **^** "Guardian University Guide 2024". *The Guardian*. 9 September 2023.
177. **^** "Good University Guide 2024". *The Times*. 15 September 2023.
178. **^** "Academic Ranking of World Universities 2023". Shanghai Ranking Consultancy. 15 August 2023.
179. **^** "QS World University Rankings 2025". Quacquarelli Symonds Ltd. 4 June 2024.
180. **^** "THE World University Rankings 2024". Times Higher Education. 28 September 2023.
181. **^** "World University Rankings". *Times Higher Education*. 26 September 2018. Archived from the original on 21 October 2018. Retrieved 28 September 2018.
182. **^** Adams, Susan. "An Expert List of the World's Best Universities". *Forbes*. Archived from the original on 28 September 2018. Retrieved 28 September 2018.
183. **^** Strauss, Karsten (23 September 2016). "The World's Top Universities 2016". *Forbes*. Archived from the original on 30 July 2017. Retrieved 20 October 2016.

</fragment>
<fragment>
184. **^** "Oxford tops Times Good University Guide for 11th year". University of Oxford. 14 June 2012. Archived from the original on 25 April 2013. Retrieved 30 December 2012.
185. **^** "Times Higher Education Clinical, Pre-Clinical & Health". 14 September 2017. Archived from the original on 10 November 2017. Retrieved 25 December 2017.
186. **^** "SCImago Institutions Rankings – Higher Education – All Regions and Countries – 2021 – Overall Rank". *scimagoir.com*. Archived from the original on 22 April 2019. Retrieved 11 June 2019.
187. **^** Morgan, John (January 1990). "Top Six Universities Dominate THE World Reputation Rankings". Archived from the original on 4 April 2014. Retrieved 7 June 2014. "The rankings suggest that the top six-...Stanford University and the University of Oxford – form a group of globally recognised "super brands".
188. **^** "Best Global Universities". *US News*. Archived from the original on 13 January 2016.

</fragment>
<fragment>
Oxford is regularly ranked within the top five universities in the world and is currently ranked first in the world in the *Times Higher Education World University Rankings*,[181][182] as well as the Forbes's World University Rankings.[183] It held the number one position in the *Times Good University Guide* for eleven consecutive years,[184] and the medical school has also maintained first place in the "Clinical, Pre-Clinical & Health" table of the *Times Higher Education (THE) World University Rankings* for the past seven consecutive years.[185] In 2021, it ranked sixth among the universities around the world by SCImago Institutions Rankings.[186] The *THE* has also recognised Oxford as one of the world's "six super brands" on its *World Reputation Rankings*, along with Berkeley, Cambridge, Harvard, MIT, and Stanford.[187] The university is fifth worldwide on the *US News* ranking.[188] Its Saïd Business School came 13th in the world in *Financial Times* *Global MBA Ranking*.[189]


</fragment>
<fragment>
189. **^** "Global MBA Ranking 2019". *Financial Times*. 12 September 2019. Archived from the original on 12 September 2019. Retrieved 12 September 2019.
190. **^** "Ten institutions that dominated science in 2022". Archived from the original on 14 December 2021. Retrieved 28 May 2019.
191. **^** "Introduction to the Nature Index". Archived from the original on 1 April 2019. Retrieved 28 May 2019.
192. **^** Mines ParisTech Professional Ranking World Universities. "Classement 2011 des universités par l Ecole des Mines le french ranking par excellence". Archived from the original on 25 September 2015.
193. **^** "The best UK universities chosen by major employers". *Times Higher Education*. London. 12 November 2015. Archived from the original on 4 March 2016. Retrieved 16 November 2015.
194. **^** "Who's Who in the Subject League Tables". Complete University Guide. Archived from the original on 7 July 2017. Retrieved 12 May 2017.

</fragment>
<fragment>

Oxford was ranked 13th in the world in 2022 by the Nature Index, which measures the largest contributors to papers published in 82 leading journals.[190][191] It is ranked fifth best university worldwide and first in Britain for forming CEOs according to the *Professional Ranking World Universities*,[192] and first in the UK for the quality of its graduates as chosen by the recruiters of the UK's major companies.[193]


In the 2018 Complete University Guide, all 38 subjects offered by Oxford rank within the top 10 nationally meaning Oxford was one of only two multi-faculty universities (along with Cambridge) in the UK to have 100% of their subjects in the top 10.[194] Computer Science, Medicine, Philosophy, Politics and Psychology were ranked first in the UK by the guide.[195]


</fragment>
<fragment>

According to the QS World University Rankings by Subject, the University of Oxford also ranks as number one in the world for four Humanities disciplines: English Language and Literature, Modern Languages, Geography, and History. It also ranks second globally for Anthropology, Archaeology, Law, Medicine, Politics & International Studies, and Psychology.[196]



## Student life[edit]


### Traditions[edit]


See also: Academic dress of the University of Oxford


</fragment>
</document>
msg.name: search

msg.content:
<document>
<title>Harvard University</title>
<fragment>
85. **^** "Which schools get the most research money?". *U.S. News & World Report*. Archived from the original on April 14, 2021. Retrieved March 30, 2020.
86. **^** "ShanghaiRanking's 2023 Academic Ranking of World Universities". Shanghai Ranking Consultancy. Retrieved February 10, 2024.
87. **^** "Forbes America's Top Colleges List 2023". *Forbes*. Retrieved September 22, 2023.
88. **^** "2023-2024 Best National Universities". *U.S. News & World Report*. Retrieved September 22, 2023.
89. **^** "2023 National University Rankings". *Washington Monthly*. Retrieved February 10, 2024.
90. **^** "2024 Best Colleges in the U.S." *The Wall Street Journal/College Pulse*. Retrieved January 27, 2024.
91. **^** "ShanghaiRanking's 2023 Academic Ranking of World Universities". Shanghai Ranking Consultancy. Retrieved February 10, 2024.
92. **^** "QS World University Rankings 2025: Top global universities". Quacquarelli Symonds. Retrieved June 6, 2024.

</fragment>
<fragment>
93. **^** "World University Rankings 2024". *Times Higher Education*. Retrieved September 27, 2023.
94. **^** "2022-23 Best Global Universities Rankings". *U.S. News & World Report*. Retrieved February 25, 2023.
95. **^** "Harvard University's Graduate School Rankings". *U.S. News & World Report*. Archived from the original on October 7, 2019. Retrieved April 27, 2020.
96. **^** "Harvard University – U.S. News Global University Rankings". *U.S. News & World Report*. Archived from the original on December 7, 2019. Retrieved April 27, 2020.
97. **^** "Academic Ranking of World Universities——Harvard University Ranking Profile". Shanghai Ranking Consultancy. Archived from the original on September 8, 2016. Retrieved July 29, 2018.
98. **^** "World Reputation Rankings 2016". *Times Higher Education*. 2016. Archived from the original on March 5, 2018. Retrieved September 7, 2016.

</fragment>
<fragment>
99. **^** "SCImago Institutions Rankings – Higher Education – All Regions and Countries – 2019 – Overall Rank". *www.scimagoir.com*. Archived from the original on April 22, 2019. Retrieved June 11, 2019.
100. **^** Lombardi, John V.; Abbey, Craig W.; Craig, Diane D. (2020). "The Top American Research Universities: 2019 Annual Report" (PDF). *mup.umass.edu*. Archived (PDF) from the original on July 17, 2021. Retrieved July 17, 2021.
101. **^** *Massachusetts Institutions – NECHE*, New England Commission of Higher Education, archived from the original on August 17, 2021, retrieved May 26, 2021
102. **^** "World Ranking". *University Ranking by Academic Performance*. Archived from the original on December 18, 2019. Retrieved January 22, 2020.
103. **^** "College Hopes & Worries Press Release". PR Newswire. 2016. Archived from the original on September 19, 2016. Retrieved September 7, 2016.

</fragment>
<fragment>
104. **^** "Princeton Review's 2012 "College Hopes & Worries Survey" Reports on 10,650 Students' & Parents' Top 10 "Dream Colleges" and Application Perspectives". PR Newswire. 2012. Archived from the original on December 10, 2019. Retrieved December 10, 2019.
105. **^** "2019 College Hopes & Worries Press Release". 2019. Archived from the original on October 7, 2019. Retrieved December 10, 2019.
106. **^** contact, Press (February 11, 2019). "Harvard is #3 in World University Engineering Rankings". Archived from the original on December 10, 2019. Retrieved December 10, 2019.
107. **^** "The Best International Relations Schools in the World". *Foreign Policy*. Archived from the original on January 29, 2021. Retrieved January 19, 2023.
108. **^** "Harvard University Campus Information, Costs and Details". *www.collegeraptor.com*. Archived from the original on November 14, 2022. Retrieved November 14, 2022.

</fragment>
<fragment>

Among overall rankings, the *Academic Ranking of World Universities* (*ARWU*) has ranked Harvard as the world's top university every year since it was released.[97]
When *QS* and *Times Higher Education* collaborated to publish the *Times Higher Education–QS World University Rankings* from 2004 to 2009, Harvard held the top spot every year and continued to hold first place on *THE World Reputation Rankings* ever since it was released in 2011.[98]
In 2019, it was ranked first worldwide by *SCImago Institutions Rankings*.[99] It was ranked in the first tier of American research universities, along with Columbia, MIT, and Stanford, in the 2019 report from the Center for Measuring University Performance.[100] Harvard University is accredited by the New England Commission of Higher Education.[101]


</fragment>
</document>

msg.content:
<document>
<title>Stanford University</title>
<fragment>
174. **^** "2023-2024 Best National Universities". *U.S. News & World Report*. Retrieved September 22, 2023.
175. **^** "2023 National University Rankings". *Washington Monthly*. Retrieved February 10, 2024.
176. **^** "2024 Best Colleges in the U.S." *The Wall Street Journal/College Pulse*. Retrieved January 27, 2024.
177. **^** "ShanghaiRanking's 2023 Academic Ranking of World Universities". Shanghai Ranking Consultancy. Retrieved February 10, 2024.
178. **^** "QS World University Rankings 2025: Top global universities". Quacquarelli Symonds. Retrieved June 6, 2024.
179. **^** "World University Rankings 2024". *Times Higher Education*. Retrieved September 27, 2023.
180. **^** "2022-23 Best Global Universities Rankings". *U.S. News & World Report*. Retrieved February 25, 2023.
181. **^** "The World's Most Innovative Universities 2019". *Reuters*.
182. **^** Oremus, Will (April 15, 2013). "Silicon Is the New Ivy". *Slate*. Retrieved June 8, 2014.

</fragment>
<fragment>
183. **^** Pérez-Peña, Richard (May 29, 2014). "To Young Minds of Today, Harvard Is the Stanford of the East". *The New York Times*. Retrieved June 8, 2014.
184. **^** "The World's Most Innovative Universities 2019". *Reuters*.
185. **^** "2022 National University Rankings".
186. **^** "These are the country's 'dream' colleges, but price remains the top concern". *CNBC*. March 27, 2022.
187. **^** "2022 College Hopes & Worries Press Release".
188. **^** "Stanford, 1st in Bloomberg Businessweek's 2022–23 US B-School Rankings". *Bloomberg.com*.
189. **^** "These Are the US's Best Business Schools". *Bloomberg.com*.
190. **^** "College Hopes & Worries Press Release". Princeton Review. Retrieved August 28, 2017.
191. **^** "2020 College Hopes & Worries Press Release". *Princeton Review*. March 17, 2020. Retrieved May 3, 2021.
192. **^** "Academic Ranking of World Universities 2022". *Shanghai Ranking*. Retrieved March 30, 2022.

</fragment>
<fragment>
44. **^** Devaney, Tim (December 3, 2012). "One University To Rule Them All: Stanford Tops Startup List – ReadWrite". *ReadWrite*. Retrieved April 6, 2018.
45. **^** "The University Entrepreneurship Report – Alumni of Top Universities Rake in $12.6 Billion Across 559 Deals". *CB Insights Research*. October 29, 2012. Retrieved April 6, 2018.
46. **^** "Box". *stanford.app.box.com*. Archived from the original on August 7, 2020. Retrieved April 15, 2018.
47. ^ ***a*** ***b*** Silver, Caleb (March 18, 2020). "The Top 20 Economies in the World". *Investopedia*. Retrieved March 18, 2020.
48. **^** Krieger, Lisa M. (October 24, 2012). "Stanford alumni's companies combined equal tenth largest economy on the planet". *The Mercury News*. Retrieved April 6, 2018.
49. **^** Elkins, Kathleen (May 18, 2018). "More billionaires went to Harvard than to Stanford, MIT and Yale combined". *cnbc*. Retrieved November 19, 2021.
50. **^** 


</fragment>
<fragment>

From polls of college applicants done by The Princeton Review, every year from 2013 to 2020 the most commonly named "dream college" for students was Stanford; separately, parents, too, most frequently named Stanford their ultimate "dream college."[190][191] Globally Stanford is also ranked among the top universities in the world. The *Academic Ranking of World Universities (ARWU)* ranked Stanford second in the world (after Harvard) most years from 2003 to 2020.[192] *Times Higher Education* recognizes Stanford as one of the world's "six super brands" on its *World Reputation Rankings*, along with Berkeley, Cambridge, Harvard, MIT, and Oxford.[193][194]



## Discoveries and innovation[edit]


See also: Carnegie Mellon discoveries and innovation, Illinois discoveries and innovation, MIT discoveries and innovation, and UC Berkeley discoveries and innovation

### Natural sciences[edit]


</fragment>
<fragment>

*Slate* in 2014 dubbed Stanford as "the Harvard of the 21st century".[182] In the same year *The New York Times* dubbed Harvard as the "Stanford of the East". In that article titled *To Young Minds of Today, Harvard Is the Stanford of the East* *The New York Times* concluded that "Stanford University has become America's 'it' school, by measures that Harvard once dominated."[183] In 2019, Stanford University took 1st place on Reuters' list of the *World's Most Innovative Universities* for the fifth consecutive year.[184] In 2022, *Washington Monthly* ranked Stanford at 1st position in their annual list of top universities in the United States.[185] In a 2022 survey by *The Princeton Review*, Stanford was ranked 1st among the top ten "dream colleges" of America, and was considered to be the ultimate "dream college" of both students and parents.[186][187] Stanford Graduate School of Business was ranked 1st in the list of America's best business schools by *Bloomberg* for 2022.[188][189]


</fragment>
</document>

msg.name: search

msg.content:
Here are the mottos of the global top 5 universities according to the QS World University Rankings 2024:

1. **Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT)**
   - Motto: "Mens et Manus" (Latin for "Mind and Hand")

2. **University of Cambridge**
   - Motto: "Hinc lucem et pocula sacra" (Latin for "From here, light and sacred draughts")

3. **University of Oxford**
   - Motto: "Dominus Illuminatio Mea" (Latin for "The Lord is my Light")

4. **Harvard University**
   - Motto: "Veritas" (Latin for "Truth")

5. **Stanford University**
   - Motto: "Die Luft der Freiheit weht" (German for "The wind of freedom blows")

Here are the mottos of the global top 5 universities according to the QS World University Rankings 2024:

1. **Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT)**
   - Motto: "Mens et Manus" (Latin for "Mind and Hand")

2. **University of Cambridge**
   - Motto: "Hinc lucem et pocula sacra" (Latin for "From here, light and sacred draughts")

3. **University of Oxford**
   - Motto: "Dominus Illuminatio Mea" (Latin for "The Lord is my Light")

4. **Harvard University**
   - Motto: "Veritas" (Latin for "Truth")

5. **Stanford University**
   - Motto: "Die Luft der Freiheit weht" (German for "The wind of freedom blows")
